Detailed Description

This is a specialised AvatarFilter that places its owner on the ground.

It is intended for use with navigating entities which have a tendency to hover above the ground as they follow the navigation mesh.

Note:
Currently the dropping is performed on input rather than output because it is less frequent and so cheaper. However this does mean that entities will clip through hills during periods of sparse input.

Entity* AvatarDropFilter::entity (  )  [inline]

const Vector3 & AvatarDropFilter::groundNormal (  )  const

The normal of the world polygon intersected during the last output drop collide, otherwise (0,1,0).

PyObjectPtr AvatarDropFilter::groundNormalProvider (  ) 

This function returns the GroundNormalProvider instance and creates one if needed.

The GroundNormalProvider object maintains a week reference relationship with its originating AvatarDropFilter.

void AvatarDropFilter::input ( double  time,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
const Vector3 &  posError,
float *  auxFiltered 
) [virtual]

This method takes the input position and does a collision check to drop it onto the collision scene.

Other than this dropping of the position the parameters are passed unchanged into the AvatarFilter.

Parameters:
time The estimated client time when the input was sent from the server.
spaceID The server space that the position resides in.
vehicleID The ID of the vehicle in who's coordinate system the position is defined. A null vehicle ID means that the position is in world coordinates.
pos The new position in either local vehicle or world space/common coordinates. The player relative compression will have already been decoded at this point by the network layer.
posError The amount of uncertainty in the position.
auxFiltered If not NULL, a pointer to an array of two floats representing yaw and pitch.

Reimplemented from AvatarFilter.

void AvatarDropFilter::onGroundNormalProviderDestroyed (  ) 

Internal function for dismantling the weak reference with the filter’s GroundNormalProvider.

void AvatarDropFilter::output ( double  time  )  [virtual]

This method just calls AvatarFilter::output.

Post avatar filter dropping is currently disabled in favour of doing it in the input method for performance reasons.

Parameters:
time The client game time in seconds that the entity's volatile members should be updated for.

Reimplemented from AvatarFilter.
